title: Basic Switch Expression
description:
Create a method that takes a month number (1-12) and returns the season:
- 12, 1, 2 -> "Winter"
- 3, 4, 5 -> "Spring"
- 6, 7, 8 -> "Summer"
- 9, 10, 11 -> "Fall"
- default -> "Unknown"

Use switch expression with arrow syntax.

Test: getSeason(7) should return "Summer"
instructions:
Create a method that takes a month number (1-12) and returns the season:
- 12, 1, 2 -> "Winter"
- 3, 4, 5 -> "Spring"
- 6, 7, 8 -> "Summer"
- 9, 10, 11 -> "Fall"
- default -> "Unknown"

Use switch expression with arrow syntax.

hints.text: Use the syntax: return switch (month) { case 1, 2 -> "value"; };
Multiple cases can share one arrow: case 12, 1, 2 -> "Winter"

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting semicolon after the switch expression
commonMistakes.correction: Switch expressions need ; at the end when used in a statement
Arrow syntax doesn't use break - the arrow implies no fall-through
